intro: Gnaphalium microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and is typically found in moist or wetland habitats. The plant has slender, often hairy stems and produces tiny, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a basal rosette, and the plant is often found in temperate regions. Gnaphalium microcephalum is also noted for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can be used in ecological restoration projects.
